headline: J. Charles Jones, 82, Civil Rights Activist Who Led Lunch Counter Sit-Ins, Dies
abstract: He was a participant in many pivotal events of the 1960s, beginning with lunch-counter protests in Charlotte, N.C.
lead_paragraph: J. Charles Jones, a civil rights activist both in Charlotte, N.C., and nationally who helped organize pivotal events and groups in the 1960s, died on Dec. 27 at his home in Charlotte. He was 82.
